title: Paramount Global stock dips after revenue falls short

contentObject.content: Shares of Paramount Global Inc. (PARA) were off 4% in premarket trading Tuesday after the company formerly known as ViacomCBS posted declining revenue and profits for its most recent quarter. The company generated net earnings of $433 million, or 64 cents a share, compared with $911 million, or $1.44 a share, in the year-earlier quarter. On an adjusted basis, Paramount earned 60 cents a share, down from $1.52 a share a year prior but ahead of the FactSet consensus, which was for 52 cents a share. Revenue edged lower to $7.33 billion from $7.41 billion a year prior, while analysts had been looking for $7.39 billion. The company noted in its earnings release that it had over 62 million "total global streaming subscribers" in the quarter and that it picked up 6.8 million additions for its Paramount+ service. Direct-to-consumer subscription revenue was up 95%, driven by Paramount+, while direct-to-consumer advertising revenue rose 59%, reflecting momentum at Pluto TV. Shares have lost about 8% over the past three months as the S&P 500 [S: SPX] has fallen about 7%.
